courses.name: Orientation to Nuclear Medicine
courses.description: An overview using a series of short rotations through local nuclear medicine departments and a self-directed review of a current text.  Clinical rotations for this course are arranged on an individual basis.  Graded on S/U basis only.

courses.name: Orientation to Clinical Practice
courses.description: This course provides an introductory experience to clinical practice. Must be accepted into Nuclear Medicine Program. Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: Restricted to Nuclear Medicine students, junior standing required

courses.name: Clinical Nuclear Medicine I
courses.description: Introductory clinical course for senior level students. Introduces instrumentation, administration, procedures, and laboratory techniques. Includes supervised clinical participation.
courses.prerequisites: NUCMED 3263 and restricted to Nuclear Medicine students only

courses.name: Morphological Correlations in Nuclear Medicine I
courses.description: Anatomy, physiology, and pathology of the human body as assessed using medicine techniques.  The first of two courses that address current clinical applications of nuclear medicine.
courses.prerequisites: NU_ENG 4303; restricted to Nuclear Medicine students only

courses.name: Introductory Radiation Biology
courses.description: (same as BIO_SC 4328, NU_ENG 4328, V_M_S 7328). Concepts of ionizing radiations, their actions on matter through effects on simple chemical systems, biological molecules, cell, organisms, man.
courses.recommendation: Sciences/Engineering; one course in Biological Sciences and  Physics/Chemistry; or instructor's consent

courses.name: Problems in Nuclear Medicine
courses.description: Supervised investigation in an aspect of nuclear medicine technology, usually culminating in a written report.

courses.name: Clinical In Vitro
courses.description: Detailed review of current regulations and procedures governing the use of open sources of radioactivity in a nuclear medicine setting.

courses.name: Clinical Nuclear Medicine II
courses.description: Continuation of clinical series taught in conjunction with NUCMED 3256 and NUCMED 4232. Addresses advanced therapeutic and diagnostic procedures, computer applications, and quality assurance procedures.
courses.prerequisites: NUCMED 3256. Restricted to Nuclear Medicine students only

courses.name: Clinical Nuclear Medicine II - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Continuation of clinical series taught in conjunction with NUCMED 3256 and NUCMED 4232. Addresses advanced therapeutic and diagnostic procedures, computer applications, and quality assurance procedures.
courses.prerequisites: NUCMED 3256. Restricted to Nuclear Medicine students only

courses.name: Clinical Nuclear Medicine III
courses.description: Final course in clinical series. Seminar discussion of the areas of professional ethics, current medical-legal considerations, and future nuclear medicine applications.
courses.prerequisites: NUCMED 3256. Restricted to Nuclear Medicine students only

courses.name: Morphological Correlations in Nuclear Medicine II
courses.description: Anatomy, physiology, and pathology of the human body as assessed using nuclear medicine techniques.  The second of two courses that address current clinical applications of nuclear medicine.
courses.prerequisites: NUCMED 3263, restricted to Nuclear Medicine students

courses.name: Nuclear Medicine Instrumentation
courses.description: Radionuclide imaging systems and the use of computers. Topics include Anger camera systems, emission tomography, ultrasound, nuclear magnetic resonance, and bone absorptionmetry.
courses.prerequisites: PHYSCS 1220 and MATH 1400, restricted to Nuclear Medicine students

courses.name: Radiopharmaceuticals in Nuclear Medicine
courses.description: Introduces concepts of radiopharmacy, generator systems, labeling of materials, quality control procedures and FDA regulations concerning radiopharmaceuticals.

courses.name: PET in Nuclear Medicine
courses.description: Overview of special isotope production techniques for positron emitting agents; instrumentation concerns beyond standard Anger imaging; and image critique and analysis with morphologic correlation.  May be repeated for credit.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: PHYSCS 1210 and NUCMED 4327 or instructor's consent.  Restricted to Nuclear Medicine students only

courses.name: Clinical In Vivo I
courses.description: Practical experience in the clinical setting with imaging procedures performed in nuclear medicine.

courses.name: Clinical In Vivo II
courses.description: Practical experience in clinical setting with advanced imaging techniques and instrument quality control.
courses.prerequisites: NUCMED 4940. Restricted to undergraduate Nuclear Medicine students

courses.name: Problems in Nuclear Medicine
courses.description: Supervised investigation in an aspect of nuclear medicine technology, usually culminating in a written report.

courses.name: Radiopharmaceuticals in Nuclear Medicine
courses.description: Introduces concepts of radiopharmacy, generator systems, labeling of materials, quality control procedures and FDA regulations concerning radiopharmaceuticals.

courses.name: PET in Nuclear Medicine
courses.description: Overview of special isotope production in techniques for positron emitting agents; instrumentation concerns beyond standard Anger imaging; and image critique and analysis with morphologic correlation.  May be repeated for credit.  Graded on A-F basis only.
courses.prerequisites: PHYSCS 1210 and NUCMED 4327 or instructor's consent
